NATIONAL NEWS






City studying gas rate increase



Jun. 3--DANVILLE -- Ryan Hatch paid a $112.34 natural gas bill in January. His natural gas bill for next January could go up $8.30 if Danville City Council adopts a proposed natural gas rate increase set to go into effect July 1. Council held a special work session May 15 devoted to the proposed 6 percent natural gas rate hike and an 18 percent increase in the city's wastewater rate.


Jun 3, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Get paid for making shade: Solar panels generate profits, ward off heat



Jun. 3--Aquila is looking for a few good solar panels, and will pay you a little if you have one.  The electrical utility company has started a rebate program for people in the Aquila service area who can supply solar power or the energy credit created by having a renewable energy source. Kenny Romero, Aquila manager of renewable energy, said the program stems from a legislative measure, ...


Jun 3, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Joining power grid no easy switch: 3 with own turbines face hassles as PUCO figures pay formula



Jun. 4--ELMORE -- It sounds so simple.  You make a big investment in wind power, solar power, or some other form of renewable energy that can put a dent in your electric bill. During peak months, you actually generate more power than what you use. So, you sit back and wait with glee for your next bill to arrive in the mail, knowing you're supposed to get reimbursed by FirstEnergy Corp.


Jun 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Federal officials want pipeline project details



Jun. 4--Developers of a natural gas pipeline that would run through Indiana are feeling pressure from federal officials that could delay construction of the $4.5 billion project.  Critical environmental information is missing from the federal application for Rockies Express-East -- the easternmost leg of a 1,663-mile pipeline that would run from Colorado to Ohio.


Jun 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Meeting to discuss gas storage plans



Jun. 4--An open house Tuesday at Lamar University will share information on an underground natural gas storage facility proposed for the Beaumont area.  AGL Resources Facility expects construction work on the $180 million project to begin next year, with it going into operation in 2010. Company personnel will meet with community leaders and residents Tuesday from 5 to 7 p.m.


Jun 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Bad weather leaves 10,000 without power in metro Detroit



Jun. 3--About 10,000 metro Detroiters still are without power -- though they're not necessarily the same customers who were in the dark as a few hours ago. That's because the wave of bad weather that's been affecting Detroit Edison customers is prompting a game of musical chairs, knocking power out from one area just as DTE restores power to another. "We've had no significant additional ...


Jun 3, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



DAN WALLACH: Senate sees us as good for what ails ERCOT



Jun. 3--It's amazing that anything gets through a Texas legislative session, given the combat among its members, the open hostilities and the mutinies. Sausage and laws, they say. You don't want to see either one made. One casualty of this year's session was a bill that got through the state House and disappeared in the state Senate. If more strenuous support had accompanied it, then Entergy ...


Jun 3, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Fairacres man energized by wind turbine



Jun. 4--LAS CRUCES -- Ben Sloter wasn't looking to save money, be green or show off to his neighbors.  He wasn't looking to be first either. Sloter, 86, just likes to stay active. In his latest project, he shunned solar panels for aesthetic reasons and instead installed a 40-foot tall power-generating wind turbine just outside his garage almost two weeks ago.


Jun 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



FTC gets order to delay Equitable-Dominion merger



Jun. 4--The Federal Trade Commission has won an order from a federal appeals court to prevent Equitable Resources Inc. from acquiring local competitor Dominion Peoples Gas, until the court can consider an appeal on the full case. The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit granted the FTC's emergency request for an injunction to stop North Shore-based Equitable from paying $970 million for ...

1,000th GE 1.5-MW wind turbine shipped for FPL Energy project



-- GE Energy and FPL Energy have announced the shipment of the 1,000th GE 1.5-MW wind turbine for an FPL Energy project. The unit will be among the 267 machines GE is supplying for FPL Energy's Peetz Table Wind Energy Center in Colorado. By year-end 2007, the number of GE wind turbines used in FPL Energy projects will be 1,426--going back to the Montfort, Wisc.

Utility's rates still tops in region



By MIKE DENNISON of the Missoulian State Bureau HELENA - If you think your electric bill has been defying gravity lately, you're right: NorthWestern Energy, which serves 320,000 customers in Montana, still has the highest rates of any major utility in the region.As of Friday, rates for NorthWestern's residential customers stood at 9.59 cents per kilowatt-hour - a full penny higher than the ...

Buckeye tosses wrench at pipe plan



The thought of a massive natural gas pipeline only a few feet underground and running through a masterplanned community in Buckeye has town officials cringing. Transwestern Pipeline Co. wants to build the natural-gas pipeline through Buckeye's planned development boom along Sun Valley Parkway. The 259-mile underground pipeline would run from Ash Fork in Coconino County, south through Yavapai and ...

Nevada solar plant to power 15,000 homes



The Nevada Solar One parabolic trough power plant located in Boulder City, near Las Vegas, will begin supplying power to the grid. The  64 megawatt power plant is the first large solar thermal power plant to be built in 15 years and will generate approximately 129 million kilowatt hours of solar electricity annually, Glass on Web reported. ...

The SEC reportedly supports Enron shareholders in high court case



WASHINGTON: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has decided to support shareholders suing Wall Street banks for damages over Enron's collapse in a seminal case before the Supreme Court, according to a newspaper report. The Enron shareholders' $40 billion lawsuit contends that Merrill Lynch, Barclays and Credit Suisse Group should be held equally liable as Enron as participants in the ...


Jun 3, 2007 International Herald Tribune



Kansas' reliance on coal for power shows in emissions



Three-fourths of the electricity Kansans use comes from coal-fired generating plants, and that heavier-than-average reliance on coal helps explain why the state is among the top 10 in carbon dioxide emissions per person. Because most scientists link CO2 to global warming, such a heavy reliance on coal worries environmentalists. Two Lawrence environmentalists are suing the Kansas Department of ...

Report: SEC is supporting Enron shareholders in high court case



[ Top ] By MARCY ZOMBIE AP Business Writer WASHINGTON (AP) -- The Securities and Exchange Commission has decided to support shareholders suing Wall Street banks for damages over Enron's collapse in a significant case before the Supreme Court, according to a newspaper report Saturday. The Enron shareholders' $40 billion lawsuit contends that Merrill Lynch & Co., Barclays PLC and Credit Suisse ...


Jun 3, 2007 Charleston Gazette





DTE Energy To Open Two Customer Offices in Detroit



DETROIT, June 4 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- DTE Energy will open two new customer offices in Detroit in an effort to better serve its customers. The new offices - at 2835 Bagley in MexicanTown and at 3000 Gratiot - will replace customer offices in Royal Oak, Hamtramck and Dearborn. The MexicanTown office will open June 11, while the Gratiot office will open July 23.

(TPF) of Omaha and eCORP, LLC of Houston, Texas today announced plans to develop a major new high-performance natural gas storage facility near Uniontown in southwestern Pennsylvania.     The facility will be developed by a jointly-owned entity, Chestnut Ridge Storage, LLC.     In the first phase of development, the facility is expected to provide about 17.5 billion cubic ...

TransCanada's Five-Year Settlement for Canadian Mainline Approved by NEB



TransCanada Corporation's (TSX: TRP)(NYSE: TRP) (TransCanada) wholly owned subsidiary, TransCanada PipeLines Limited, announced today it has received approval from the National Energy Board (NEB) for a five-year settlement with stakeholders regarding 2007 tolls and costs for years 2008 to 2011 on its Canadian Mainline natural gas transmission system. Average U.S. Electricity Prices Jump 4.7 Percent



Following a stunning increase of nearly 11 percent in the year ending in April 2006, the average price of electricity for industrial or large commercial entities in the United States jumped another 4.7 percent over the past year. Public comment sought on wind energy plan



The Latrobe City Council is seeking public comment on its draft strategy for wind energy developments. The city's manager of planning and development, Carol Jeffs, says the plan looks at current uses of land in the municipality, and local industry potential. Ms Jeffs says although Latrobe is not as windy as other areas in Victoria, existing energy infrastructure may assist in future projects ...


Jun 4, 2007 ABC Online



Physicists turn 'waste' into electricity



Physicists have developed a way to turn heat into sound and then electricity, suggesting a new way to effectively recycle waste energy. "We are converting waste  in an efficient, simple way by using sound," said the scientist who led the effort, Orest Symko of the University of Utah. "It is a new source of renewable energy from waste heat." Symko's recycling devices are cylinder-shaped ...

New Fuel Cell Twice As Efficient As Generators



Hank Green writes 'A new kind of Solid Oxide  Fuel Cell has been developed that can consume any kind of fuel, from hydrogen to bio-diesel; it is over two times more efficient than traditional generators. Acumentrics is attempting to market the technology to off-grid applications (like National Parks) and also for home use as personal Combined Heat and Power plants that are extremely efficient ...

This acquisition is the first step in Trigon's plan to establish a ...

INTERNATIONAL NEWS







Energy companies make wind power a top investment



LONDON: From Mitsubishi Heavy Industries to E.ON, the world's largest companies are investing in wind power, the best-performing energy in the past year. Led by Vestas Wind Systems and Iberdrola of Spain, utilities and governments in the United States, China and Europe will spend as much as $150 billion on wind projects in the next five years, according to CLSA Research.


Jun 4, 2007 International Herald Tribune



Alstom to Construct the Largest Combined Heat and Power Plant in the UK



LEVALLOIS PERRET, France--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Regulatory News : Alstom (Paris:ALO) has signed a contract worth 580 million euro with the European utility E.ON for the construction of a 1,275 MW turnkey combined heat and power plant (CHP)* at the Isle of Grain in Kent, United Kingdom. In addition, Alstom has signed a long-term service agreement with E.ON for a twelve year period.


Jun 4, 2007 Business Wire



MWH Awarded Three Ohio Hydroelectric Projects



MWH, a global provider of environmental engineering, construction and strategic consulting services, announced today that it has been selected by American Municipal Power-Ohio (AMP-Ohio) to serve as  the Owner's Engineer for the design and construction of three new hydroelectric projects on the Ohio River. All three facilities will be located at existing locks and dams and will have a combined ...


Jun 4, 2007 PR Newswire



CB&I Awarded LNG Project in Chile



THE WOODLANDS, Texas--(BUSINESS WIRE)--CB&I (NYSE:CBI) has been awarded a contract by GNL Quintero S.A. of Chile to build a liquefied natural gas (LNG) regasification terminal at Quintero Bay, Chile. The contract is valued at approximately $775 million. GNL Quintero S.A. is a joint venture between Endesa Chile, ENAP, Metrogas Chile and BG Group plc (NYSE:BRG).
